judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
Judgment of sentence is affirmed.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: Thomas P. Hamilton, Jr., for appellant.

Tram Nedurian, Jr., Assistant District Attorney, with him Ralph B. D’lorio, Assistant District Attorney, William- R. Tool, Jr., First Assistant District Attorney, and Stephen J. McEwen, Jr., District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Oakley, Appellant.
Argued May 2, 1969.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
May 28, 1969:
Thomas P. Hamilton, Jr., for appellant.
Tram Nedurian, Jr., Assistant District Attorney, with him Ralph B. D’lorio, Assistant District Attorney, William- R. Tool, Jr., First Assistant District Attorney, and Stephen J. McEwen, Jr., District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
